title: PeachVar-DB Portal
description: PeachVar-DB: interactive browsing and visualization of a curated collection of peach genetic variation data obtained from whole-genome resequencing experiments
license: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International License.

meta.value: PeachVar-DB: interactive browsing and visualization of a curated collection of peach genetic variation data obtained from whole-genome resequencing experiments

forms.title: Search by region
forms.subtitle: Find and explore genomic variants in PeachVar-DB. Please select a genomic region of interest (Chromosome, Start and End position) in order to display associated variants. You can also decide whether you are interested only in SNPs or INDELS or both. Please be aware that the coordinates system correspond to the peach reference genome version 2.0.

elements.subtitle: Click on the buttons to automatically load a search query. SNP array data has been obtained from GDR site.

forms.subtitle: Find and explore genomic variants in PeachVar-DB. Please select one of these genetic features: "CDS", "5’ UTR", "Gene", "mRNA" or "3’ UTR". The "Gene name" field can be indicated or not.

pages.title: Home
pages.long_description: Next-generation sequencing technologies applied to many species of horticultural interest are bearing the potential to accelerate the understanding and exploitation of genetic resources. PeachVar-DB is an open-source catalog of genetic variants present in peach (P. persica L. Batsch) and wild-related species of Prunus genera, annotated from 146 Whole Genome Re-Sequencing (WGRS) experiments publicly released on Sequence Reads Archive (SRA). Our scope is to make quickly and easily accessible a large amount of information from WGRS projects for a range of purposes, spacing from genotyping to functional genomics. The web interface of the database is designed for an intuitive and user-friendly exploration and provides several tools for searching and downloading the data, along with useful data statistics and information.

elements.title: Distribution of types of variants found by each algorithm

pages.subtitle: In this section you can navigate the phenotypic data associated to the 146 accessions of Peach

elements.title: Details (persica)
elements.subtitle: Click on the pie-charts on the left to display details about the trait of interest

elements.title: Details (wild-relatives)
elements.subtitle: Click on the pie-charts on the left to display details about the trait of interest

elements.title: Download data
elements.subtitle: The variant calling procedure has been performed using three algorithms: Freebayes, GATK and BCFtools and the 146 accessions have been analyzed through a joint variant calling procedure. Only the genetic variants identified by all the three algorithms have been selected in order to obtain a more reliable result. Once obtained, the final joint VCF file has been splitted into individual samples and consequently zipped and indexed with bgzip utility from samtools suite (http://www.htslib.org/doc/tabix.html). Here you can download the annotated VCF file relative to each of the 146 accessions.

pages.title: Population structure
pages.long_description: Population structure inferred from 50k randomly selected SNPs in ADMIXTUREv1.22. The analysis is performed by inputting successive values of K (a priori genetic clusters) from 2 to 8. A cross-validation procedure in Admixture software has been used to identify the value of K that maximizes the predictive accuracy (i.e. that minimizes CV-error) based on a 10-fold cross-validation with 10 different fixed initial seeds

elements.title: Population structure
elements.subtitle: Values on Y-axis indicate the membership probability to each a priori cluster. Admixture model-based simulations were carried out by varying K from 2 to 10 with 10 iterations using all 146 genotypes which showed evident knees at K = 2, differentiating prunus persica from wild relatives. A value of K = 4 explains most of the ancestry within accessions, differentiating the cluster of wild relatives (P4) and ornamental peach (P2) from edible peach (P1 and P3), showing various degree of admixture. For higher values of K, landraces and accessions derived from Oriental and Occidental breeding tend to separate.

elements.title: Cross-validation plot
elements.subtitle: A cross-validation procedure has been used to identify the value of K that maximizes the predictive accuracy based on a 10-fold cross-validation with 10 different fixed initial seeds

elements.title: Graph of population structure according to the selection of K
elements.subtitle: Click on the yellow buttons to select a given K. Hover on the plot to see details of specific accessions and the associated clusters.

pages.title: Phylogenesis
pages.long_description: The evolutionary relationship among accessions was inferred from whole-genome SNPs data using SNPhylo (filtering and MUSCLE alignment). The dendrogram has been built from pairwise similarity matrix by using a Maximum Likelihood estimate in PhyML 3.0.

elements.title: Accession Cloud
elements.subtitle: Schematic representation of the total number of variants (INDELS and SNPS) in the 146 analyzed accessions of peach and wild-relatives. Size of accession names correlates to the number of associated variants. If the cloud is not visible (e.g., misrendered/collapsed cloud), please update the page.

elements.title: SNP density by region (peach)
elements.subtitle: The plot displays the number of SNPs for selected bins (genomic intervals) of predefined size, calculated through the SNPdensity function in VCFtools.

elements.subtitle: The plot displays the number of SNPs for selected bins (genomic intervals) of predefined size, calculated through the SNPdensity function in VCFtools.

elements.title: Linkage disequilibrium (LD) by region
elements.subtitle: The plot displays the degree of linkage disequilibrium (r2)  i.e the non-random association of alleles at different loci, among the whole SNPs dataset as calculated using a sliding window analysis with a fixed bin of 100 kb and step of 50 kb for SNPs separated by a maximum of 15 kb, using an in-house R-script. For the analysis SNPs were phased by using Beagle v4.0 and pairwise LD value were estimated using ld-window function in VCFtools.

elements.title: Nucleotide diversity (π)
elements.subtitle: the plot displays the nucleotide diversity (π) between P. persica accessions and wild-relatives, i.e the degree of polymorphism measured through the average number of per site nucleotide differences between all possible pairs of DNA sequences in the selected population

elements.subtitle: The plot displays the number of annotated transcripts on peach genome v2.1 for selected bins (genomic intervals) of predefined size, calculated using BEDOPS echo count function.

pages.title: About
pages.long_description: PeachVar-DB is an open-source catalog of genetic variants present in peach (P. persica L. Batsch) and wild-related species of Prunus genera, annotated from 146 publicly released Whole Genome Re-Sequencing experiments hosted under the Sequence Reads Archive (SRA). The current database release is assembled onto peach reference genome version v2.0 and contains a total of 4,630,814 SNPs and 461,785 INDELs, identified through the intersection of the results from three variant-calling algorithms: GATK, BCFtools and FreeBayes. The detected peach variants derive from a selection of high confident and accurate consensus call set obtained by comparing the results of each variant calling algorithm and reporting only those supported by all algorithms.

data.value: The web interface of Peach-VarDB provides several tools for searching and downloading SNP and INDEL variants under the Searching menu:

data: Search by region function for retrieving the selected variant type (SNP or INDEL) in specific genomic region;
Search by gene features function for retrieving all variants within user defined gene models;
Search by gene ID function for retrieving all variants within a particular gene of interest (transcripts are coded based on the JGI nomenclature for peach genome v2.1 annotations);
Search by accession function for navigating within all the variants identified in the queried accession;
Search by sequence similarity function for BLAST search against the peach genome assembly
Pairwise accession comparison function for pairwise genotype comparisons between two selected accessions.

data.value: The results from each query, are integrated with a range of additional annotations, including BioSample/BioProject information, peach mapped genetic markers, syntenic maps, gene homologous, Gene Ontology (GO) annotations and links to genetic variants previously identified through SNP array technologies and provide by GDR portal (https://www.rosaceae.org/).
The 'Accession info' section provides a dataset information of the accession panel and related resources (SRA and Bioproject), population structure, phylogenesis and basic phenotypic data

PeachVar-DB integrates a JBrowse interface (http://hpc-bioinformatics.cineca.it/jbrowse/JBrowse-1.12.1/index.html?data=data%2FpersicaV2) for a panning and zooming navigation of the peach reference genome, and including gene models, putative orthologous from other species (cherry, rice and Arabidopsis thaliana) and the direct visualization of SNPs/INDELs location. Furthermore, the user can load and visualize a custom track file (gff, VCF, SAM or BAM format). The user should ensure that the coordinates system present in his custom file correspond to the 2.0 version of peach reference genome. The Statistics section provides a range of useful statistics about the number of annotated variants, whole-genome linkage disequilibrium patterns, SNP density, nucleotide diversity and gene density are shown in a dynamical summary or interactive histograms.

PeachVar-DB is developed on the AngularJS framework (v. 1.6.4) which presents data in a dynamic manner within a single-page application (SPA). The graphical user interface has been implemented through Angular material library (v. 1.1.4), a reference implementation of Google's Material Design Specification. The front-end relies also on third-party graphical libraries, such as d3, angular-chart and md-data-table.

Peach-VarDB is funded by the LISA Initiative, supported in equal parts by Regione Lombardia and Consortium CINECA; Italian Node of Elixir project (http://elixir-italy.org) for high performance computing resources. This work is also funded by the University of Milan and MasPes project.

Genome Database for Rosaceae (GDR, http:/www.rosaceae.org), the long-standing central repository and data mining resource for Rosaceae research.Phytozome V12.1 (https://phytozome.jgi.doe.gov), a comparative platform for green plant genomics.
What is PeachVar-DB portal?

PeachVar-DB is an open-source catalog of genetic variants present in peach (P. persica L. Batsch) and wild-related species of Prunus genera, annotated from 146 Whole Genome Re-Sequencing (WGRS) experiments publicly released on Sequence Reads Archive (SRA). Our scope is to make quickly and easily accessible a large amount of information from WGRS projects for a range of purposes, spacing from genotyping to functional genomics. The web interface of the database is designed for an intuitive and user-friendly exploration and provides several tools for searching and downloading the data, along with useful data statistics and information.
How do I access PeachVar-DB?
The access to PeachVar-DB is public and free.
How do I cite PeachVar-DB?
We have no published paper right now.
How do I ask questions?
Please send an email to hpc-service-bio AT cineca.it.
How can I query PeachVar-DB?
We have implemented different types of search panels. You can query by:

data: Region: make your query by starting from either a chromosome and/or positions;
Gene feature: include in results 5'UTR, 3'UTR, CDS, primary transcripts and CDS+Introns;
Gene ID: start your search by gene ID (e.g., Prupe1G000100);
Accession: see all the genetic variants associated with a given accession.
